Reviews.Title: “Fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: NUR25a
Reviews.Content: This place is fab. My room mate and I arrived after just upping and leaving from another place (because it was so awful) without having another place to stay. We rolled up on their doorstep before they were even open to see if they had rooms spare. Straight away we were given a place to put our massive suitcases and offered drinks despite them being officially closed. This hotel is set on three floors. We had a twin room on the top floor - it was basic, but very clean and wonderful compared to our previous place. The walls are white, there's a fridge and a TV, limited hanging space and some storage by our beds - again it is small, but I think other people's reviews are harsh...show me a room that doesn't need a lick of paint now and again! Yes there's some noise, but come on, you're in the middle of the city, of course it's going to be noisy!! However the noise we experienced was city noise - traffic and people, and nothing from the pub down below. The owner Steve is fantastic and went out of his way so many times to help us, helping us sort out our month loing stay, whilst his team including Sam the caretaker (fab and only a phone call away) and Elliot, the very kind bar person that also helped us out. This place really is wonderful & I would recommend it to everyone. It's in the perfect location - you can see the tube station from the window and several bus stops are nearby - and the team that run it are fab.

Reviews.Title: “smelly and noisy”
Reviews.Author: hotelsmotels_12
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to rough it at the Wynyard. My room was so noisy from the traffic that I had to stick my earplugs so far down my ear canal that I almost pushed them right into my brain. The whole place reeks of mould and garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap basic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rendezvousnz
Reviews.Content: Good price, five minutes walk from the train and bus. Shared kitchen and bathrooms. Rooms are basic with an overhead fan a tv, mini fridge, bed and clothes rack. Situated about a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: m0nza
Reviews.Content: Ok well we stayed in 2 room's at this hotel, which were both clean and tidy. Beds were good and i didnt hear a thing at night. The hotel is in a great location with shops close by and train just a few minutes walk...we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in a box on the street is a better option”
Reviews.Author: RossMon
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I've stayed in some dives before, but this takes the cake. Think Psycho and the Bates Motel...not the luxury shower scene Motel rooms, think the creepy house on the hill. The room smelled like a toilet, the shower was disgusting and had a towel with blood on it hanging on the rail. Their website is very misleading. Significant safety issues too. This isn't a hotel of last resort for me, I'd prefer to spend the night on the street.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Seans4u
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in worse places around Sydney.. For the cost of the accommodation, I found it to be very clean and the bed was comfortable.. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived which is understandable at 10am but the hotel staff were friendly and allowed us to leave our luggage while we went out for breakfast. They even took our bags up to our room.. If your looking for somewhere just to sleep, then its a great hotel.. I did take my own pillow after reading other peoples reviews but it wasn't really necessary.. The meals in the hotel were no worse than any other hotel we had dinner at while there.. For a 2 star hotel, I would highly recommend it over other places.. Its a great location, close to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Public Transport..

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: CanberraVovo
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Wynyard Hotel was met with appalling and unprofessional service. A communication error between Wotif and the hotel resulted in one of our guests without a bed. In trying to resolve this calmly with staff, the response on numerous occasions was one of indifference, they simply didnâ€™t care and were unwilling to find an adequate solution. In the end, one of guests was left to sleep on the floor. Staff were also condescending and rude. We were most unimpressed with our stay, and the stress of the incident ruined our trip. I would never stay at Wynyard Hotel again, and would strongly advise others against doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Vile, vile vile”
Reviews.Author: Melys43
Reviews.Content: Absolutely filthy. Bar was closed over the weekend, so no-one came to clean the communal facilities. I had to complain twice to the caretaker before he eventually came and ran a dirty mop over the floor. Continental beakfast consisted of stale cereal and mouldy bread. If you have a cardboard box to sleep in, I would consider that first!

Reviews.Title: “so disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bgadventures
Reviews.Content: so I read some good reviews before booking this hotel. I have absolutely no idea why. My toom was a twin. It was on the third floor which was good because there was no noise. However it took me about 10 minutes to lob my 25kg suitcase up all the stairs. The room was actually fine and quite clean however my light didnt work... there was no remote for the tv... and no coffee making facilities. The kitchen was absolutely horrible. The window opposite the stove and sink lead to some kind of dingy hole. There were flying bugs gallore flying through onto the dishes and the food. Nobody had bothered to replace the sponge which smelt like baby vomit despite the fact that there was a fresh one under the sink. I would not eat the stale 'continental breakfast' so I bought my own food. The girl at the bar who checked me out was strikingly rude, it was unbelievable. However there was a nice blonde girl who helped me take my bag back down the stairs. I did only paid 60 bucks for one night (thankgod it was only one night). While I understand that you "get what you pay for", having someone remove the dirty,used tampon which remained in the OPEN toilet bin for 2 days straight is not alot to ask.... The caretaker was quite friendly and happy to help me out.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy noisy noisy”
Reviews.Author: rroger_rramjet
Reviews.Content: I had an OK room, they are very small, but was directly over the bar on the first floor right above one of the ceiling mounted speakers - I couldnt sleep for the thumping doof music, my room actually vibrated !! The staff come in early and turn the TV on really loud at around 6.30am so unless your on the 2nd or 3rd floor I really wouldnt recommend it. I had to check out and went elsewhere for my 5 day stay. The management made it very difficult to get my money back and I had to forfeit a nights rates. Anything to get out and get a decent nights sleep !! The breakfast was ok and the bathroooms were ok but for $30 more per night I got a beautiful, large and quiet!! room just 100m up the road. The bar staff were actualy quite friendly and the counter meals are good, its just a shame they flog off that 1st floor accomodation to any sucker that will pay for it. Ask for the 2nd or 3rd floor and you'll probably be ok. Think backpackers/boarding house, not hotel though. They only get that name 'cause it's a pub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stefaneh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in December Â´07 and we were really satisfied. We were only supposed to stay 5 days but we still got the lower week price. The lower floor is a restaurant/bar with good offers like 7 dollar meals. There is often a lot of people but it never got messy or annoying. The thing to understand is that it is a kind of backpackers with shared bathrooms but without the noise and mess and you get the benefit of room cleaning and towels. The rooms are small but they are cleaned every day and you get a TV with cable and a fridge. There is a fan in the roof that works, light on or off. It can get noisy in the rooms but what to expect when you stay downtown in a large city, that's what earplugs are for. We stayed on the third floor so we did not notice any noise from the bar The location is probably the greatest part you are situated minutes from Darling Harbour, and in walking distance from Norther Quay and Chinatown. The staff was friendly, manager to cleaning lady. Breakfast is milk, toast,jam, juice and cereals served all day in the kitchen. No problems with the shared showers or toilets. The rooftop veranda was great for a late night beer. Thats also were the washer and dryer was located, which was free of charge. If you want to stay in a cheap clean place with great location and donÂ´t care about sharing bathrooms this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: harrykeryn
Reviews.Content: If you don't have time to read my review - DO NOT BOOK THIS PLACE> it is horrible, dirty. You would be better in a Backpacker hostel. I had come to come online and write a review on every website where someone could possibly book this hotel. Unfortunately, the site we booked it from didn't have any reviews so we went on the information provided by the Hotel. We arrived at the hotel and couldn't find the front door, called the phone number and a man came down in full casual dress and opened the door which lead to a very steep staircase. My Mum went up the stairs with the man to our room. There was no lobby, no real entrance. The room was the width of a double bed. You opened the door and the double bed was within one step. I guess that is what "Double Room" meant. The window was open as the only source of air with no fly screen, there was a fan on that only worked with the light on. No room for our cases either. The bathroom and toilet were communal and across the hallway. The "free complimentary breakfast" included (per Door man's exact words) - "there's milk in the fridge and help yourself to the container of cereal in the kitchen. We immediately left and got a room at the Menzie's Hotel - might have been more expensive but there was no way on earth we were staying there. My Mum's words were, I will stay up all night before sleeping there. Be warned - do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It. So noisy, we checked out after the first night.”
Reviews.Author: adularia
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by their web site like my boyfriend and I were. This place was the WORST place we have ever stayed, and we've stayed at a lot of hostels/budget hotels throughout Europe and Australia. Basically, the rooms are literally above the bar/casino and although we were aware of that upon checking in, what we didn't realize is that at about 7PM they crank up the techno/club music that was so loud it literally vibrated our room until 3AM. Needless to say, we didn't get much sleep and the outside traffic noise was so loud that we were awoken by 7AM (after just 4 hours of sleep), so we checked out that morning because we couldn't bare to stay another night. What's worse, we were booked for four nights and the manager refused to credit us for the remaining 3 nights, and would only give us 2 nights credit so we basically ended up paying $180 for 4 hours of sleep. (By the way, our replacement hotel turned out to be terrific and even CHEAPER than The Wynyard - stay at The George Street Hotel if you're on a budget and still want a clean, quiet and convenient place to stay - we highly recommended it!). Back to the Wynyard, the bathroom was so disgusting, I wouldn't even use it. Basically, it's an open room with two toilets and two shower stalls with flimsy, moldy shower curtains that offer no privacy whatsoever. The supposed "continental breakfast" turned out to be stale cornflakes stored in filthy tupperware containers. At $90 per night, the management of this place should be ashamed.

HotelInfo.Name: Wynyard Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Corner Clarence and Erskine Streets, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
